TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract XMLNode

Docs.summary: Represents a single XML element applied to a document.

remarks.para: Each XML element that has been applied to a document is displayed as a node in a tree view control in the XML Structure task pane. Each node in the tree view is an instance of an object. The hierarchy in the tree view indicates whether a node contains child nodes.

Use the property of the collection to return an individual object. Use the method to verify that an XML element is valid according to the applied schemas and that any required child elements exist and are in the required order. Once you run the method, use the property to verify whether an element is valid, and use the property to display information about what the user needs to do to make the document conform to the XML schema rules.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Attributes As XMLNodes

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents the attributes for the specified element.

remarks.para: All objects in the XMLNodes collection returned by using the Attributes property have a property value of wdXMLNodeAttribute.

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public ReadOnly Property BaseName As String
public: property System::String ^ default { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String that represents the name of the element without any prefix.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ChildNodes As XMLNodes

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents the child elements of a specified element.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ChildNodeSuggestions As XMLChildNodeSuggestions

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents the list of allowed elements for the object (which returns the child elements of a specified element).

remarks.para: Each object in a collection is an item in the list of allowed possible XML elements at the bottom of the XML Structure task pane.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Copy() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Copies the specified object to the Clipboard.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the specified object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Cut() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Removes the specified object from the document and places it on the Clipboard.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Delete() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Deletes the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FirstChild As XMLNode
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XMLNode ^ FirstChild { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XMLNode ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the first child node of a parent node.

remarks.para: Use the property to access the last child node. Use the property to access the parent node in a diagram.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HasChildNodes As Boolean
public: property bool HasChildNodes { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Determines if the specified XML element has child elements.

remarks.para: This property returns True if the specified XML element has child elements, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LastChild As XMLNode
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XMLNode ^ LastChild { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XMLNode ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the last child node of a parent node.

remarks.para: Use the property to access the first child node in a diagram. Use the property to access the parent node in a diagram.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Level As WdXMLNodeLevel

Docs.summary: Returns the level of the specified XML element within the hierarchy of elements applied to a document.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property NamespaceURI As String
public: property System::String ^ NamespaceURI { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String that represents the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the schema namespace for the specified object.

remarks.para: If you're authoring XML schemas for use with Microsoft Word, it is highly recommended that you specify the targetNamespace setting in the schema.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property NextSibling As XMLNode
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XMLNode ^ NextSibling { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XMLNode ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the next element in the document that is at the same level as the specified element.

remarks.para: If the specified element is the last element in the collection, this property returns Nothing.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property NodeType As WdXMLNodeType

Docs.summary: Returns a constant that represents the type of node.

remarks.para: can be one of the following wdXMLNodeType constants:
wdXMLNodeAttribute – Indicates an attribute node.
wdXMLNodeElement – Indicates an element node.

A object can be either an XML element or an attribute of an element. Use the NodeType property to determine which type of node you are working with so that you don't attempt to perform invalid operations on the node. For example, the property applies only to element nodes, although it will appear in the list of available properties for the XMLNode object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ NodeValue { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.NodeValue : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String that represents the value of an attribute.

remarks.para: A object can be either an XML element or an attribute of an element. Use the property to determine which type of node you are working with.
For XMLNode objects with a NodeType value of wdXMLNodeElement, the NodeValue property returns nothing.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OwnerDocument As Document

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the parent document of the specified XML element.

remarks.para: The OwnerDocument property returns the same results as the property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the parent object of the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ParentNode As XMLNode
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XMLNode ^ ParentNode { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XMLNode ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the parent element of the specified element.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ PlaceholderText { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.PlaceholderText : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String that represents the text displayed for an element that contains no text.

remarks.para: Placeholder text is displayed in Microsoft Word only when the Show XML tags in the document check box in the XML Structure task pane is cleared. The Show XML tags in the document check box corresponds to the property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PreviousSibling As XMLNode
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XMLNode ^ PreviousSibling { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XMLNode ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the previous element in the document that is at the same level as the specified element.

remarks.para: If the specified element is the first element in the collection, this property returns Nothing.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Range As Range
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Range ^ Range { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Range ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the portion of a document that's contained in the specified object.

remarks.para: For information about returning a range from a document, see the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RemoveChild([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode ChildElement) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required . The child element to be removed.
Docs.summary: Removes the specified child element from the specified element.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNodes SelectNodes (string XPath, string PrefixMapping = "", bool FastSearchSkippingTextNodes = false);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNodes SelectNodes([in]string XPath, [in]string PrefixMapping, [in]bool FastSearchSkippingTextNodes) runtime managed
Public Function SelectNodes (XPath As String, Optional PrefixMapping As String = "", Optional FastSearchSkippingTextNodes As Boolean = false) As XMLNodes
abstract member SelectNodes : string * string * bool -> Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNodes

Docs.param: Required String. A valid XPath string. For more information on XPath, see the XPath reference documentation on the Microsoft Developer Network (MSDN) Web site.
Optional Object. Provides the prefix in the schema against which to perform the search. Use the parameter if your parameter uses names to search for elements.
Optional Boolean. True skips all text nodes while searching for the specified node. False includes text nodes in the search. Default value is False.
Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents all the nodes that match a specified XPath string in the order in which they appear.

remarks.para: Setting the parameter to True diminishes performance, because Microsoft Word searches all nodes in a document against the text contained in the node.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode SelectSingleNode (string XPath, string PrefixMapping = "", bool FastSearchSkippingTextNodes = false);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode SelectSingleNode([in]string XPath, [in]string PrefixMapping, [in]bool FastSearchSkippingTextNodes) runtime managed
Public Function SelectSingleNode (XPath As String, Optional PrefixMapping As String = "", Optional FastSearchSkippingTextNodes As Boolean = false) As XMLNode
abstract member SelectSingleNode : string * string * bool -> Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode

Docs.param: Required String. A valid string. For more information on , see the reference documentation on the Microsoft Developer Network (MSDN) Web site.
Optional Object. Provides the prefix in the schema against which to perform the search. Use the parameter if your parameter uses names to search for elements.
Optional Boolean. True skips all text nodes while searching for the specified node. False includes text nodes in the search. Default value is True.
Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the first node that matches a specified XPath string in the specified document.

remarks.para: Setting the parameter to False diminishes performance because Microsoft Word searches all nodes in a document against the text contained in the node.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetValidationError (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdXMLValidationStatus Status, ref object ErrorText, bool ClearedAutomatically = false);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetValidationError([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdXMLValidationStatus Status, [in]object& ErrorText, [in]bool ClearedAutomatically) runtime managed
Public Sub SetValidationError (Status As WdXMLValidationStatus, Optional ByRef ErrorText As Object, Optional ClearedAutomatically As Boolean = false)
abstract member SetValidationError : Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdXMLValidationStatus * obj * bool -> unit

Docs.param: Required . Specifies whether to set the validation status error text (wdXMLValidationStatusCustom) or to clear the validation status error text (wdXMLValidationStatusOK).
Optional Object. The text displayed to the user. Leave blank when the Status parameter is set to wdXMLValidationStatusOK.

Optional Boolean. True automatically clears the error message as soon as the next validation event occurs on the specified node. False requires running the SetValidationError method with a parameter of wdXMLValidationStatusOK to clear the custom error text.
Docs.summary: Changes the validation error text displayed to a user for a specified node and forces Microsoft Word to report a node as invalid.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SmartTag As SmartTag

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the smart tag associated with an XML element.

remarks.para: XML elements can have smart tag actions assigned to them through external components that implement the ISmartTag interface. For more information on smart tags and how to create recognizers and action handlers, refer to the Smart Tag Software Development Kit on the Microsoft Developer Network (MSDN) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Text { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Text : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String that represents the text displayed for an XML element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Validate() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Verifies an individual XML element or the entire document against the attached XML schema or schemas.

remarks.para: Use the Validate method with the and properties to determine if an XML element is valid against the applied schema and what error text to display to the user. Use the method to override the schema violations with custom validation errors.
When you run the Validate method, Microsoft Word populates the collection with the XML nodes that have validation errors.

MemberSignature.Value: public string ValidationErrorText[bool Advanced = false] { get; }
Public ReadOnly Property ValidationErrorText(Optional Advanced As Boolean = false) As String
public: property System::String ^ ValidationErrorText[bool] { System::String ^ get(bool Advanced); };

Docs.param: Optional Boolean. Indicates that the error text displayed is the advanced version of the validation error description, which comes from the MSXML 5.0 component included with Microsoft Word.
Docs.summary: Returns a String that represents the description for a validation error on an object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ValidationStatus As WdXMLValidationStatus

Docs.summary: Returns a constant that represents whether an element or attribute is valid according to the attached schema.

remarks.para: WdXMLValidationStatus can be one of the following constants:
wdXMLValidationStatusCustom Indicates that the method was used to set property to a custom text string.
wdXMLValidationStatusOK Indicates an XML element or attribute is valid according to the attached schema.

While these are the only two named constants the ValidationStatus property allows, there are many more unnamed values that come from the MSXML 5.0 component included with Microsoft Word. For more a complete list of possible values and their corresponding meaning, refer to the Microsoft Word XML Content Development Kit on the Microsoft Developer Network (MSDN) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property WordOpenXML As String
public: property System::String ^ WordOpenXML { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String that represents the XML for the node in the Microsoft Office Word Open XML format. Read-only.

remarks.para: This property returns only the XML in the document that is needed to represent the specified XML node.

MemberSignature.Value: public string XML[bool DataOnly = false] { get; }
Public ReadOnly Property XML(Optional DataOnly As Boolean = false) As String
public: property System::String ^ XML[bool] { System::String ^ get(bool DataOnly); };

Docs.param: Optional Boolean. True returns the text of the XML without the Word XML markup. The default setting is False.
Docs.summary: Returns a String that represents the XML text in the specified object.
